name: Automated functional tests
description: Using behat, phantom js, headless chome and jenkins

name: Infrastructure as code
description: We standardized around Terraform for all our Infrastructure providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)

name: Static security testing
description: Using SensioLabs Security Checker for PHP apps

name: Ansible
description: Ansible's role has been significantly diminished and will no longer be used for config management at the VM level (given that most projects now run on Kubernetes). However, we will keep using Ansible to deploy certain Helm charts inside Kubernetes clusters.

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler. Webpack takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules. It takes the dependencies and generates a dependency graph allowing web developers to use a modular approach for their web application development purposes.

name: Varnish
description: Will be used mainly on Magento projects

name: RabbitMQ
description: RabbitMQ's excellent support for queues and pub/sub make it a good candidate for projects requiring advanced messaging features. For projects running on Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure we highly encourage our teams to first look at the messaging services offered by the respective cloud platforms, but for AWS or on-prem based workloads RabbitMQ can be the first choice.

name: Azure DevOps
description: Former Visual Studio Team Services, an Azure-based CI, Git hosting, project management and test planning tool.

name: AWS Code Deploy
description: Given that we standardized the code deployment process around Kubernetes + GitLab CI or Azure DevOps Pipelines, AWS CodeDeploy is not longer necessary even for AWS-based projects.

name: Gulp
description:
Gulp is an open-source JavaScript toolkit by Fractal Innovations and the open source community at GitHub, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development. It is a task runner built on Node.js and npm, used for automation of time-consuming and repetitive tasks involved in web development. 
Will be used for non-bundling tasks.

name: Wordpress
description: Wordpress is extremely efficient for building simple content management platforms or corporate websites, so it looks like it will be a long-time presence in our portfolio. However, it will only be used by the digital experience team.

name: Docker
description: Docker is a computer program that performs operating-system-level virtualization also known as containerization.

name: WooCommerce
description: WooCommerce is an open source e-commerce plugin for WordPress. It is designed for small to large-sized online merchants using WordPress.

name: Vagrant
description: All new projects started after Q4 2019 will be using Docker for the local development environment, so Vagrant will be completely retired.

name: Drupal 8
description: We decided to stop using Drupal 8, as the developer experience was incompatible with our current team. Furthermore, a lot of projects required simple suite-building, with little or no coding involved, which basically dillutes our competitive advantage.

name: Ethereum
description: Ethereum is an open-source, public, blockchain-based distributed computing platform and operating system featuring smart contract (scripting) functionality.

name: Blockchain
description: blockchain ca tehnologie suport care ofera data integrity, tracebility si distributed ledger

name: PrestaShop
description: As our experience with PrestaShop is limited and projects based on the technology are sparse, we decided to give up on it.

name: Magento 1.x
description: Magento is an open-source e-commerce platform written in PHP.

name: OpenCart
description: OpenCart is an open source PHP-based online e-commerce solution.

name: Shopify
description: Shopify is a SaaS e-commerce solution. You can develop apps (modules) or themes using the Shopify SDK.

name: ASP.NET Core
description: ASP.NET Core/5 's portability, containerization support and developer experience make it the most loved web framework according to Stack Overflow's Developer Survey 2021. It is a technology we will not only invest in, but focus on intensively throughout 2021 and 2022 to expand its reach within Zitec.

name: Symfony 5
description: Symfony is a PHP web application framework and a set of reusable PHP components/libraries.

name: React.js
description: In computing, React.js is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

name: Next.JS
description: Next.JS promises to deliver a more pleasant and efficient developer experience for front-end heavy applications requiring server-side rendering. We will test the framework on a customer project to validate its value proposition, but at first glance it does seem like it would be a major upgrade compared to our existing alternatives.

name: Laravel
description: Laravel is a free, open-source PHP web framework, created by Taylor Otwell and intended for the development of web applications following the model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern and based on Symfony.

name: Vue.js
description: Vue.js is an open-source progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Integration into projects that use other JavaScript libraries is made easy with Vue because it is designed to be incrementally adoptable. Vue can also function as a web application framework capable of powering advanced single-page applications.

name: Symfony 3 & 4
description: Symfony is a PHP web application framework and a set of reusable PHP components/libraries.

name: ASP.NET MVC
description: We'll be switching to ASP.NET Core/5 starting with September 2021, as it's a technology that provides significantly better developer experience, as well as compatibility with containerization technologies.

name: Python
description: Given the limited knowledge we have, as well as the difficulty experienced in finding new colleagues or customers on this technology, we will scale back our efforts and instead focus on Node.JS as the third back-end web development language in the company.

name: Zend Framework 1.x, 2.x
description: Zend Framework is a PHP web application framework and a set of reusable PHP components/libraries.

name: Phalcon Framework
description: A full-stack PHP framework delivered as a C-extension

name: Backbone.JS
description: Backbone.js is a JavaScript library with a RESTful JSON interface and is based on the Model–View–Presenter (MVP) application design paradigm. Backbone is known for being lightweight, as its only hard dependency is on one JavaScript library, Underscore.js, plus jQuery for use of the full library.
